It had been a few days since we started working\non recipes.%K%P
Shion's knife handling skills had improved a lot\nduring that time.%K%P
At this point I could just relax and watch from\na distance.%K%P
\dIt's done! I think I nailed it this time!\d%K%P
\dYup, looks pretty decent to me!\d%K%P
\dRight? Aki, could you give it a taste?\d%K%P
\dSure, could I get some chopsticks?\d%K%P
\dActually, I think you might prefer it another\nway... Open up your mouth, say aah.\d%K%P
\dAaah...\d%K%P
I did as I was told and Shion fed me her cooking.%K%P
It was embarrassing doing this every time, but\nI was starting to get used to it.%K%P
\dSo? How is it? I really pulled out the stops on\nthis one, it should be pretty good.\d%K%P
\dWell... It's more edible than before.\d%K%P
\dOh, great. In other words, it sucks, huh?\d%K%P
\dIt's definitely...edible. At least you got the\ntexture down.\d%K%P
\dThat's not good enough. ...Ew, this is way\ngross. Another fail...\d%K%P
\dHold up. Don't just toss it. I'll eat the rest\nof it.\d%K%P
I managed to intercept Shion halfway to the\ntrash can.%K%P
\dYou'll eat it? But it's not any good, right?\d%K%P
\dThe taste doesn't bother me. You made it, Shion,\nso I don't want it to go to waste.\d%K%P
Shion put a lot of effort into making this food.%K%P
I'd rather eat it than let her throw it all away.%K%P
\dAki, you really don't need to.\d%K%P
\dBut I've gotta admit, I am really happy to hear\nyou say that.\d%K%P
\dNow, where were we? Say aah.\d%K%P
\dAaah...\d%K%P
\dHeh-heh, I like this. It makes me feel like\na proper mistress.\d%K%P
\dYou're officially one of my wives now.\nThat's about as 'proper' as it can get.\d%K%P
\dAw, you're making me blush.\d%K%P
Shion smiled, her face starting to burn up.%K%P
\dBut if I'm gonna cook for you, I'd rather serve\nsomething really delicious.\d%K%P
\dYou've improved a lot since we first started.\d%K%P
\dThat's because I started out really bad! It's like\nwith games - the more you play, the harder\nit gets to level up.\d%K%P
\dCooking is like that too.\d%K%P
On the first day Shion hadn't even been able to\nprep her ingredients properly.%K%P
It was pretty impressive to see her whipping up\ndishes now. I got what she was trying to\nsay, though.%K%P
\dEverything you do gives you a few more experience\npoints, right? As long as you don't give up, you'll\nget there in the end.\d%K%P
\dWell, I'll try my best, anyway.\d%K%P
\dYup, and you'll do great.\d%K%P
\dAnyway, how's the recipe coming?\d%K%P
\dHonestly, the more I cook, the more lost I feel.\d%K%P
\dIt's weird. I didn't expect this to be\nso complicated.\d%K%P
From figuring out seasoning proportions to how to\ncut the konnyaku, cooking was a lot of work.%K%P
Plus, Shion was trying to create a whole new\nrecipe from scratch.%K%P
\dAt this rate, we're never gonna get anywhere.\d%K%P
\dWhen you hit a wall, it's best to seek advice from\nexperienced cooks.\d%K%P
\dYou mean Yukari and Kaede?\d%K%P
\dThey're the first ones who come to mind.\d%K%P
\dSure, but like I said before, I don't want to get\ntoo dependent on those two.\d%K%P
\dYou won't be asking them to come up with the\nrecipe for you. Their input could help you\nthink of something.\d%K%P
I liked to cook too, but I definitely lacked the\nproper knowledge to come up with a new recipe.%K%P
And Shion only had access to online recipes.\nShe could only get so far without some more\nhands-on advice.%K%P
\dTell them exactly what you're looking for\nand listen to what they have to say.\d%K%P
\dOkay. I guess I'd be wasting my resources if\nI didn't.\d%K%P
\dAll right! I'll ask them at lunch today!\d%K%P
\dSo you decided to create a recipe!\nI knew you were working on something.\d%K%P
After lunch, Shion asked Yukari and Kaede for\ntheir help.%K%P
\dI can't believe you were feeding Akira your\ncooking behind my back!\d%K%P
\dThat's not fair, Shion! I bet you lured him in by\nsaying stuff like 'I'm serving myself as dessert.'\d%K%P
\dChill out, Yukari. We were just cooking.\d%K%P
\dThen again, we did feed each other a lot. I didn't\nthink I'd like it so much!\d%K%P
\dIs this true, Akira?\d%K%P
Thanks a lot, Shion.%K%P
Why would you stir things up like that?%K%P
Now I'd have to suffer through Yukari and\nKaede's glares.%K%P
\dTrust me, nothing weird happened.\d%K%P
\dThat's not the point! Why should Shion get you\nall to herself?\d%K%P
\dAkira, let's exchange deep kisses and feed each\nother too! Please?\d%K%P
\dHow vulgar. I'd be happy enough if you just\nfed me.\d%K%P
\dVulgar? I'm only trying to deepen the love we\nfeel for each other.\d%K%P
\dWe'll talk about that another time, all right?\d%K%P
\dThe recipe's our first priority. Are you two in?\d%K%P
\dOf course! I'd never say no to you, Akira.\d%K%P
\dMe too. If Shion's asking for help, I'd be\nglad to oblige.\d%K%P
It was so encouraging to hear that they were\nwilling to help.%K%P
\dI appreciate it.\d%K%P
\dThanks, Yukari, Kaede!\d%K%P
\dIn return, I get Akira to myself for a whole day!\nGot it?\d%K%P
\dEnough. Time to whip something up in the kitchen.\d%K%P
\dH-Hey! You can't tie me up now!\d%K%P
Kaede bound the feisty Yukari with utmost grace\nand led the way to the kitchen.%K%P
\dI'm surprised I've actually got used to seeing\nthis sight.\d%K%P
\dSame here.\d%K%P
Sharing one last smile, we followed after them.%K%P
By the time we got to the kitchen Kaede and Yukari\nwere already prepping.%K%P
Since they were usually in charge of the cooking,\nthey knew their way around much better than\nme or Shion.%K%P
\dThey're like a couple of pro chefs! There's no way\nI could ever compete with those two.\d%K%P
\dOur cooking's child's play compared to theirs.\d%K%P
Afraid of getting in their way, I didn't dare\ntouch anything.%K%P
\dMy preparations are done. How's it going for\nyou, Yukari?\d%K%P
\dI'm all set! I hate to admit it, but you really\ndo have it down around the kitchen.\d%K%P
\dI've been cooking a long time. So, what kind of\nthing were you thinking of making?\d%K%P
\dAn elder-friendly konnyaku dish!\d%K%P
\dI looked up recipes online, but I haven't been\nall that successful.\d%K%P
We had tried out lots of them, but none stood out\nas the one we needed.%K%P
\dI see, what a wonderful idea. With that in\nmind, let's get cooking!\d%K%P
\dLet me think... I have a good idea of which\ningredients to use.\d%K%P
\dYes. We'll focus on one item at a time.\d%K%P
\dJust out of curiosity, what is it you guys were\ntesting out earlier?\d%K%P
\dWe were trying to make konnyaku dressed with tofu\nand miso. It seemed so easy, but...\d%K%P
\dYeah, it turned into a total disaster.\d%K%P
She was right about that.%K%P
I barely managed to wash it down with lots of tea.\nFrankly, I wouldn't have finished if Shion\nhadn't been feeding me.%K%P
\dDid it look like a big mush of food coloring?\d%K%P
\dHey, I can cook better than that! ...I can now,\nanyway.\d%K%P
\dSo it was like that in the beginning...\d%K%P
\dYeah, it was hard to swallow.\d%K%P
\dAkira, you mean you ate it?\d%K%P
\dI'm so glad you survived.\d%K%P
\dBoo, forget about past failures. Time to give\nsomething new a try!\d%K%P
\dOh, that's right. Wait right here while I whip\nsomething up.\d%K%P
\dAkira! I want you to watch me cook, okay?\d%K%P
Just like how they prepped earlier, Yukari and\nKaede immediately got to cooking.%K%P
In what felt like no time at all, their finished\ndishes were set before us on the table.%K%P
\dWow! It looks delicious!\d%K%P
\dIt's even visually appealing.\d%K%P
Both dishes were a treat for the senses.\nJust looking at them stirred up my appetite.%K%P
\dBon appetit!\d%K%P
\dAll right.\d%K%P
\dLet's eat!\d%K%P
*munch* \d...Wow! They're both delicious!\d%K%P
\dOf course. They were made by Yukari and\nKaede, after all.\d%K%P
Everything tasted excellent. It was hard to say\nwhich dish I preferred.%K%P
*munch, munch* \dI was too naive to think that I would\nbe able to cook at this level.\d%K%P
\dIt's like cooking is an elite enemy, and I'm just\na noob.\d%K%P
\dIt sure is good. The old folks would probably\nenjoy this just as it is.\d%K%P
\dNot so fast. This is only the first attempt.\nWe have to develop it from here.\d%K%P
\dI'm surprised at how good it is.\d%K%P
\dYup, my tastes buds agree. I love the seasoning,\nno complaints there. And the flavors are\nstrong and bold.\d%K%P
I appreciated that they were both cooking to my\nown tastes, but the seniors could probably use\na little less salt.%K%P
\dI can't help but cook according to your\npreferences, Akira.\d%K%P
\dYou gotta tone down the Akira levels in\nyour cooking!\d%K%P
\dThat's a tough request...\d%K%P
I had to admit, it was pretty amazing that Yukari\nseasoned food to my liking at an unconscious\nlevel.%K%P
\dAll you have to do is use less salt.\d%K%P
\dI'll do my best.\d%K%P
\dNow that we've got feedback, let's see if we can\nmake some improvements.\d%K%P
They continued to cook like there was no tomorrow,\nusing up all the konnyaku we had stocked up.%K%P
As a result, we were able to concoct a great\nrecipe by nightfall.%K%P
\dVoila!\d%K%P
\dDid you post that recipe yet?\d%K%P
\dYup, it's out there. I made sure to tag it\n'Goddess Approved' so it'll get a ton of hits in\nno time!\d%K%P
The recipe was good to go, but Shion just had to\ntake it one step further.%K%P
To get even more feedback, she posted it online\nto see how others reacted.%K%P
\dHow long will this take?\d%K%P
\dIt's an eye-catching, delicious recipe.\nI expect to see responses within a day.\d%K%P
\dThen again, I can't be 100\p sure, so let's\ngive it a few days just in case.\d%K%P
\dIn the meantime, should we practice making it\nsome more?\d%K%P
\dNah. I tried, but it only proved how I'm much\nbetter at eating than cooking.\d%K%P
\dIt's sad that I won't get to cook for the old\nfolks after all, but at least I can give them a\ntasty recipe.\d%K%P
\dAre you gonna be okay with that?\d%K%P
\dEvery time I fed you, I felt bad for making you\neat such yucky food.\d%K%P
\dSo, yeah. I'm okay with this.\d%K%P
\dWell then, I guess I'll just relax and read some\ncomics or play some games while we wait.\d%K%P
\dToo bad. I was looking forward to more of\nyour cooking.\d%K%P
Shion gave me a blank expression.%K%P
\dYou have a thing for garbage-tier food, Aki?\d%K%P
\dNot at all. I just thought it'd be a shame for\nyou to quit now, especially since you've\nimproved so much.\d%K%P
She really had put in a lot of work.%K%P
Did she really have to give up here?%K%P
\dHmm, I'll think about it.\d%K%P
She replied half-heartedly and went to go play\ngames.%K%P
I could understand.%K%P
I didn't push her any further.%K%P
The recipe Shion posted online was met with an\noverwhelmingly favorable reception.%K%P
Every comment had something good to say. It was a\nsolid win all across the board.%K%P
Shion was so confident she scheduled a meeting to\npresent the recipe to the elderly, but on the\nmorning of the meeting...%K%P
\dHuh? Is Shion still in bed?\d%K%P
I had come back from running some errands but\nShion hadn't come out of her room yet.%K%P
\dShe's supposed to present the recipe today, right?\nDon't tell me she forgot.\d%K%P
I knew she wasn't that irresponsible. It worried\nme that she wasn't up yet.%K%P
What else could I do besides wake her?%K%P
Just as I stood up to go to her room, the door to\nthe living room clattered open.%K%P
\dOh, morning Shion. You're up late--\nWait, what?!\d%K%P
\dHaaahhh... Morning, Aki.\d%K%P
\dSeriously? What are you wearing?!\d%K%P
Shion was practically half naked, walking into the\nroom like it was no big deal.%K%P
Her unbuttoned shirt was hanging loosely off her\nshoulders, and it was obvious she wasn't\nwearing a bra.%K%P
\dHuh? Whassa matter?\d%K%P
Unaware of her appearance, she tilted her head in\nconfusion, looking at me through half-closed eyes.%K%P
It seemed like the slightest movement might make\nher shirt fall off.%K%P
For a moment I thought I caught a glimpse of\nsomething I shouldn't have, but I chose to think\nthat it was just my imagination.%K%P
\dEhehe, sorry. I overslept.\d%K%P
\dI meant to only play my game for a little bit\nlast night, but ended up getting way into it.\d%K%P
\dI was shocked when I saw the sun come up.\d%K%P
\dYeah, anyway...uhh... You might want to check\nyour clothes...\d %K%P
\dHmm? Your face is red, Aki. Do you have a fever?\d%K%P
Half-asleep, Shion came closer to me.%K%P
I couldn't help but notice her soft, flawless skin,\nhuggable body and long, slender arms and legs.%K%P
I suppressed the urge to stare at Shion's beauty\nand managed to look away.%K%P
\dAki, you're acting really weird right now.\nYou keep looking away... Ah.\d%K%P
\dOh. Uh, Aki. Did you see...?\d%K%P
\dUm... Yup. Saw it all.\d%K%P
\dR-Right. Hah... Haha...\d%K%P
Judging by those nervous noises, she must've\nfinally realized how little she was wearing.%K%P
\dW-Well... I guess it's my fault for wandering in\nhere still half-asleep. I didn't mean to show\nyou like this...\d%K%P
\dUh... Aki, I'm sorry!\d%K%P
\dWhoa!\d%K%P
Before I knew it, Shion was hugging me.%K%P
\dSh-Shion? What are you...\d%K%P
\dNo! Please, just don't look at me right now.\d%K%P
\dI'm too embarrassed.\d%K%P
Peeking out between her hair, her ears were\nbright red.%K%P
\dWhat should I do, then?\d%K%P
\dLet me be like this a little longer.\d%K%P
\dJust until my feelings settle down.\d%K%P
\dGot it...\d%K%P
I could feel Shion's bare skin on mine. From this\ndistance I could even feel her heartbeat.\nThis moment had become unexpectedly intimate.%K%P
The minutes passed by in silence.%K%P
Yes I was nervous, but in another sense it just\nfelt right.%K%P
\dA-All right, I'm fine. I feel calm now.\d%K%P
\dOh. Great, okay.\d%K%P
We were both finding it hard to find the words\nto fill this silence.%K%P
Although Shion said she was fine, she wasn't\npulling away.%K%P
\dShion? You said you calmed down, right?\d%K%P
\dY-Yup. I did... But, well... So...\d%K%P
\dTh-Thank you, Aki!\d%K%P
\dNo need to thank me...\d%K%P
\dNot true. You helped me cook and to think of\na recipe. You were always there. I want to thank\nyou from the bottom of my heart.\d%K%P
\dSo, this is a token of gratitude. Thank you so\nmuch, Aki.\d *smooch*%K%P
Shion's lips brushed mine for a split second.%K%P
It was enough, though. I lost all sense of\nreason.%K%P
\dShion.\d%K%P
\dAhh...\d *smooch* \dAki!\d *kiss, kiss*%K%P
I hugged her back and kissed her over and over.%K%P
\dKiss me more.\d *kiss*%K%P
*smooch*%K%P
Shion stepped away just when I thought we would\ngo on kissing forever.%K%P
A sudden sense of loneliness rushed through me\nas her warmth disappeared. It was a miracle\nI didn't say anything in protest.%K%P
\dI-It's time!\d%K%P
\dOh, that's right.\d%K%P
I got so focused on kissing, I completely forgot\nthat I was supposed to be reminding Shion to\nget ready.%K%P
\dTh-Then, I'll get changed.\d%K%P
\dY-Yeah, please do.\d%K%P
After Shion scrambled out of the room, I could\nfeel the tension leave my body.%K%P
\dShion's body was so soft...\d%K%P
Wait, what the heck was I thinking?!%K%P
\dAh, my face is hot.\d%K%P
I'm sure my face was as just red as Shion's.%K%P
I calmed myself down and went to see her off.%K%P
Still fresh from our impromptu make out session,\nwe were a little embarrassed, but we couldn't help\nbut grin at each other.%K%P
\dI feel like kissing you again.\d%K%P
\dRight now? I'd be all for it.\d%K%P
\dNo. That was my thanks to you. I'll kiss you\neven better next time, just you wait.\d%K%P
\dOkay, I'm looking forward to it.\d%K%P
\dAll right. See you later!\d%K%P
\dGive the seniors my regards.\d%K%P
Shion left, full of energy.%K%P
I'd wanted to go with her, but I had work to do\naround the shrine.%K%P
\dShe'll be fine, right?\d%K%P
Even though she just needed to pass on the recipe\nwhen she made her usual rounds, I had a\nbad feeling I couldn't shake off.%K%P
\dMaybe I'm just overthinking it.\d%K%P
Still, I had a bad feeling about it...%K%P
\dI'm back...\d%K%P
\dWelcome back. What happened? You look sad.\d%K%P
A drastically less enthusiastic Shion returned\nat the end of the day.%K%P
\dIt's just, I've realized that trying to show off\nis never worth it.\d%K%P
\dWhat do you mean? Did something happen?\d%K%P
\dYup, one of those 'reap what you sow' situations.\d%K%P
Something must really be bothering her. I'd never\nseen Shion this down.%K%P
\dCan I ask what happened?\d%K%P
\dUgh...\d%K%P
\dIt's fine if you don't want to say, but maybe\ntalking about it will help you feel better?\d%K%P
\dOkay... I did want to tell you, anyway.\d%K%P
\dSo, I went to give the recipe to the grandpas,\nright? And it was really well received.\d%K%P
\dThat's great! So your plan was a success.\d%K%P
\dNot quite. After that, they asked me if I thought\nit up all by myself and...I kinda said I did.\d%K%P
\dNow that much would've been manageable. But silly\nme, I took it further and said my cooking was even\nbetter than Kaede's.\d%K%P
\dSo now they want me to cook for them...\d%K%P
\dLet me guess... You told them you would?\d%K%P
\dYup. I can't go back on it and tell them I was\nlying now. I promised I'll cook them all a\ndelicious meal...\d%K%P
That was going to be difficult promise to keep.%K%P
\dWh-What should I do, Aki?\d%K%P
\dI can't cook at all. They're going to be\nso disappointed!\d%K%P
\dHmm... Did you set a date for this?\d%K%P
\dNot a definite one, but we said sometime\nnext week.\d%K%P
Next week, huh?%K%P
That gave us a little time, but not long enough\nto polish Shion's cooking skills completely.%K%P
\dWhat are you supposed to be making? I hope it's\nnothing too complicated.\d%K%P
\dThe new recipe. I bragged that I make it the best\nout of the three of us.\d%K%P
In that case, Shion might manage to pull through,\neven though it really wouldn't be on the same\nlevel as something made by Yukari or Kaede.%K%P
\dAll right. It's all about practice now.\d%K%P
\dYou think I can pull it off?\d%K%P
\dIt's not going to be easy, but I think you can do\nit. Besides, it's not like you have a choice.\d%K%P
I didn't like that she'd lied, but I was glad this\nmeant she'd start cooking again.%K%P
Plus, the initial plan had been to serve Shion's\ncooking anyway.%K%P
\dYou can't give up now. I'll help you out any way\nI can, so let's give it our best shot.\d%K%P
\dOkay Aki. I'll do my best!\d%K%P
\dThat's the spirit!\d%K%P
And like that, Shion was on board with cooking\nagain.%K%P
We'd have to master this recipe by next week,\nno matter what.%K%P
